alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Wichita, eastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties through 630 PM MDT/730 PM CDT/... At 557 PM MDT/657 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Sharon Springs to 6 miles north of Horace to 11 miles east of Tribune. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sharon Springs around 610 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Leoti and Wallace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
